depart.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey
depart.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
ocean liners arriving at and departing from the island
Dorothy departed for Germany last week.
depart.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people usually say leave or go rather than depart:
What time does the next plane leave/go?
She left for Germany last week.
Flights leave from Gatwick on Tuesdays.
depart.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to start to use new ideas or do something in a different way
depart.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: It’s revolutionary music; it departs from the old form and structures.
In his speech, the president departed from his text only once.
depart.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to leave an organization or job
